title: Handle a Contestable Life Insurance Claim
description: A death claim has been filed on a policy that is still within the two-year contestability period.

tasks.description: Identify that the claim is within the contestability period.
tasks.expected_outcome: The claims examiner flags the claim for additional investigation.

tasks.description: Order the deceased's medical records to compare against the information provided on the application.
tasks.expected_outcome: The examiner orders all relevant medical records from the insured's doctors.

tasks.description: Review the records for any material misrepresentations. If none are found, approve the claim.
tasks.expected_outcome: After review, the examiner finds no misrepresentations and proceeds to approve and pay the claim.
